page.title: 11Employment
page.content: In addition to opportunities for employment in Knighton itself is the Garth Lane slaughterers and pet food factory employing 11 people. Built in 1983/84 it deals with about 20 wholesalers all over Great Britain,one of whom retails it to Iceland.The company owns four slaughter houses which collect casualty animals from vets and farms.The hides are sent for tanning and sold to manufacturers of clothing and leather wear.The raw flesh meat is sold to Bewdley and Woburn Abbey Safari Parks and Zoos. The one-time labour intensive farming now shrunk to the average employment figure of one full time employee per farm especially where family assistance was availible. Women either are employed in Knighton or work at home. Some of their homes are farms.
